description: Borrowed from French friable, from Latin friābilis (“friable”), from friō (“I crumble”).

adjectives.description: friable (comparative more friable, superlative most friable)

entries.meaning: Easily broken into small fragments, crumbled, or reduced to powder.
(of soil) Loose and large-grained in consistency.
(of poisons) Likely to crumble and become airborne, thus becoming a health risk
(mathematics, of a number) Smooth: that factors completely into small prime numbers.
